isisISAdjIPAddrTable.name: isisISAdjIPAddrTable
isisISAdjIPAddrTable.description: This table contains the set of IP Addresses of neighboring Intermediate Systems as reported in received IIH PDUs. If the isisSysRestrictLanAdjsToSubnet object in isisSysTable is set to 'true' then for an IPv4 broadcast circuit, only IP addresses on the same subnet as the local circuit are included in this table.

isisISAdjIPAddrEntry.name: isisISAdjIPAddrEntry
isisISAdjIPAddrEntry.description: Each entry contains one IP Address reported by a neighboring Intermediate System in its IIH PDUs.

isisISAdjIPAddrIndex.name: isisISAdjIPAddrIndex
isisISAdjIPAddrIndex.description: An index to this table which identifies the IP addresss to which this entry belongs.

isisISAdjIPAddrType.name: isisISAdjIPAddrType
isisISAdjIPAddrType.description: The type of one IP Address as reported in IIH PDUs received from the neighbor.

isisISAdjIPAddrAddress.name: isisISAdjIPAddrAddress
isisISAdjIPAddrAddress.description: One IP Address as reported in IIH PDUs received from the neighbor.

isisISAdjProtSuppTable.name: isisISAdjProtSuppTable
isisISAdjProtSuppTable.description: This table contains the set of protocols supported by neighboring Intermediate Systems as reported in received IIH PDUs.

isisISAdjProtSuppEntry.name: isisISAdjProtSuppEntry
isisISAdjProtSuppEntry.description: Each entry contains one protocol supported by a neighboring Intermediate System as reported in its IIH PDUs.

isisISAdjProtSuppProtocol.name: isisISAdjProtSuppProtocol
isisISAdjProtSuppProtocol.description: One supported protocol as reported in IIH PDUs received from the neighbor.

isisISAdjProtSuppLocalSupport.name: isisISAdjProtSuppLocalSupport
isisISAdjProtSuppLocalSupport.description: Whether local configuration allows use of this protocol to this neighbor. The value 'false' indicates that the protocol is unusable.

isisISAdjProtSuppBfdStatus.name: isisISAdjProtSuppBfdStatus
isisISAdjProtSuppBfdStatus.description: BFD session state for this protocol. The state inactive(2) indicates that the protocol is unusable for forwarding because a BFD session cannot be established or has failed.

isisIPRATable.name: isisIPRATable
isisIPRATable.description: The table of IP Reachable Addresses to networks, subnetworks or hosts, learned automatically. DC-ISIS does not support the manual addition of entries using this table. This table is read-only. In order to specify reachable addresses manually, configure a static route in the Address Family Manager, and configure the AFM to pass the static route into DC-ISIS. In DC-RTM, this can be done using the static routes table (rtmStaticRtTable), and the redistribution table (rtmRedistTable).

isisIPRAEntry.name: isisIPRAEntry
isisIPRAEntry.description: Each entry defines an IP Reachable Address to a network, subnetwork or host. Each IP Reachable Address may have multiple entries in the table, one for each equal cost path to the reachable address.

isisIPRADestType.name: isisIPRADestType
isisIPRADestType.description: The type of this IP Reachable Address.

isisIPRADest.name: isisIPRADest
isisIPRADest.description: The destination of this IP Reachable Address. This is either a network address, subnetwork address or host address.

isisIPRADestPrefixLen.name: isisIPRADestPrefixLen
isisIPRADestPrefixLen.description: The length of the IP Netmask for Reachability Address.

isisIPRANextHopIndex.name: isisIPRANextHopIndex
isisIPRANextHopIndex.description: Index of next hop. Used when there are multiple Equal Cost Multipath alternatives for the same destination.

isisIPRANextHopType.name: isisIPRANextHopType
isisIPRANextHopType.description: The type of the IP next hop address. For the DC-ISIS implementation, this field is not stored and is therefore not returned in GETs for this MIB.

isisIPRANextHop.name: isisIPRANextHop
isisIPRANextHop.description: The IP next hop to this destination. For the DC-ISIS implementation, this field is not stored and is therefore not returned in GETs for this MIB.

isisIPRAType.name: isisIPRAType
isisIPRAType.description: The type of this IP Reachable Address. Those of type manual are created by the network manager. Those of type automatic are created through propagation of routing information from another routing protocol. DC-ISIS only supports automatic entries in this table. These are learnt from an Address Family Manager (for example, DC-RTM), or from the I3 stub.

isisIPRAExistState.name: isisIPRAExistState
isisIPRAExistState.description: The state of this IP Reachable Address. This object follows the ExistenceState behavior.

isisIPRAAdminState.name: isisIPRAAdminState
isisIPRAAdminState.description: The administrative state of the IP Reachable Address. This object follows the AdminState behavior.

isisIPRAMetric.name: isisIPRAMetric
isisIPRAMetric.description: The metric value for reaching the specified destination over this circuit.

isisIPRAMetricType.name: isisIPRAMetricType
isisIPRAMetricType.description: Indicates whether the metric is internal or external.

isisIPRAFullMetric.name: isisIPRAFullMetric
isisIPRAFullMetric.description: The wide metric value for reaching the specified destination over this circuit.

isisIPRASNPAAddress.name: isisIPRASNPAAddress
isisIPRASNPAAddress.description: The SNPA Address to which a PDU may be forwarded in order to reach a destination which matches this IP Reachable Address. DC-ISIS does not support this field.

isisIPRAMtId.name: isisIPRAMtId
isisIPRAMtId.description: The topology that this reachable address is in.

isisLSPSummaryEntry.name: isisLSPSummaryEntry
isisLSPSummaryEntry.description: Each entry provides a summary describing an LSP currently stored in the system.

isisLSPLevel.name: isisLSPLevel
isisLSPLevel.description: At which level does this LSP appear?

isisLSPID.name: isisLSPID
isisLSPID.description: The 8 byte LSP ID, consisting of the SystemID, Circuit ID, and Fragment Number.

isisLSPSeq.name: isisLSPSeq
isisLSPSeq.description: The sequence number for this LSP.

isisLSPZeroLife.name: isisLSPZeroLife
isisLSPZeroLife.description: Is this LSP being purged by this System?

isisLSPLifetimeRemain.name: isisLSPLifetimeRemain
isisLSPLifetimeRemain.description: The remaining lifetime in seconds for this LSP. For a current LSP (isisLSPZeroLife is 'false'), this indicates the time remaining before the LSP will expire. For an LSP being purged from the system (isisLSPZeroLife is 'true'), the LSP remains in the database for ZeroAgeLifetime, and this will indicate the time remaining before final deletion of the LSP.

isisLSPIDHostname.name: isisLSPIDHostname
isisLSPIDHostname.description: The hostname corresponding to the system ID part of the isisLSPID object. This is the null string if no hostname is known.

isisLSPTLVEntry.name: isisLSPTLVEntry
isisLSPTLVEntry.description: Each entry describes an LSP current stored in the system.

isisLSPTLVIndex.name: isisLSPTLVIndex
isisLSPTLVIndex.description: The index of this TLV in the LSP. The first TLV has index 1 and the Nth TLV has an index of N.

isisLSPTLVSeq.name: isisLSPTLVSeq
isisLSPTLVSeq.description: The sequence number for this LSP.

isisLSPTLVHostname.name: isisLSPTLVHostname
isisLSPTLVHostname.description: The hostname corresponding to the system ID part of the isisLSPID object. This is the null string if no hostname is known.

isisPmSjTable.name: isisPmSjTable
isisPmSjTable.description: This table contains information on joins on which the Protocol Manager acts as a slave. Each row in this table represents one slave join in the Protocol Manager.

isisPmSjEntry.name: isisPmSjEntry
isisPmSjEntry.description: Represents a join for which the Protocol Manager is slave.

isisPmSjInterface.name: isisPmSjInterface
isisPmSjInterface.description: Identifies the interface provided on this slave join.

isisPmSjMasterEntity.name: isisPmSjMasterEntity
isisPmSjMasterEntity.description: Index which uniquely identifies the master entity among other entities of the same component within this instance of DC-ISIS.

isisPmSjJoinStatus.name: isisPmSjJoinStatus
isisPmSjJoinStatus.description: The status of the slave join.

isisPmMjTable.name: isisPmMjTable
isisPmMjTable.description: This table controls which entities the Protocol Manager should join to as master. Each join is represented by a row in this table. The status of each join is represented by a read-only object within each row. Only routing protocol joins may be configured in this MIB. Rows in this table for other join types are read only.

isisPmMjEntry.name: isisPmMjEntry
isisPmMjEntry.description: Represents a join for which the Protocol Manager is master.

isisPmMjInterface.name: isisPmMjInterface
isisPmMjInterface.description: Identifies the interface required of this master join. This object follows the index behavior.

isisPmMjSlaveEntity.name: isisPmMjSlaveEntity
isisPmMjSlaveEntity.description: Identifies the slave entity to join with. This index is used in the join user data, to enable FTI-specific code within System Manager to select a suitable slave entity. This object follows the index behavior.

isisPmMjAddrType.name: isisPmMjAddrType
isisPmMjAddrType.description: Identifies the slave entity to join with. This is used along with the isisPmMjSlaveEntity (with address subtype 'none') in the join user data on an RPI join, to enable FTI-specific code within System Manager to select a suitable slave entity. The value is 'none' if isisPmMjInterface is not ifRtProtoInput. This object follows the index behavior.

isisPmMjMtId.name: isisPmMjMtId
isisPmMjMtId.description: The topology that this join is for. Note that this only applies to RPI joins. If multi-topology IS-IS is not supported then this field should be set to zero. This object follows the index behavior.

isisPmMjRowStatus.name: isisPmMjRowStatus
isisPmMjRowStatus.description: The row status for this master join, used to create and destroy table entries.

isisPmMjAdminStatus.name: isisPmMjAdminStatus
isisPmMjAdminStatus.description: The administrative status of this master join, used to start and stop the join.

isisPmMjOperStatus.name: isisPmMjOperStatus
isisPmMjOperStatus.description: The current operational status of this master join.

isisPmMjJoinStatus.name: isisPmMjJoinStatus
isisPmMjJoinStatus.description: The status of the master join.

isisPmMjSubAddrFamily.name: isisPmMjSubAddrFamily
isisPmMjSubAddrFamily.description: Identifies the sub address family this join is for. Note that this only applies to RPI joins. The value is ignored if isisPmMjInterface is not ifRtProtoInput.

isisIgpShortcutTable.name: isisIgpShortcutTable
isisIgpShortcutTable.description: The table of IGP shortcut tunnel interfaces known to DC-ISIS.

isisIgpShortcutEntry.name: isisIgpShortcutEntry
isisIgpShortcutEntry.description: Each entry corresponds to one IGP shortcut tunnel interface known to DC-ISIS on this system.

isisShortcutIfIndex.name: isisShortcutIfIndex
isisShortcutIfIndex.description: The value of ifIndex for the IGP shortcut tunnel interface.

isisShortcutRemoteAddressType.name: isisShortcutRemoteAddressType
isisShortcutRemoteAddressType.description: The Type of IP address for this remote address.

isisShortcutRemoteAddress.name: isisShortcutRemoteAddress
isisShortcutRemoteAddress.description: The IP Address value for this remote address.

isisShortcutMetricType.name: isisShortcutMetricType
isisShortcutMetricType.description: The type of metric value assigned to this IGP shortcut. The type of metric value can be one of the following. - 'metricTypeAbsolute'; the metric defined by isisShortcutMetricValue is used as the cost of the IGP shortcut. - 'metricTypeRelative'; the metric value defined by isisShortcutMetricValue is added to the IGP-calculated cost of reaching the egress of the shortcut to determine the cost of the IGP shortcut. Note that, in this case, the metric value may be zero, positive or negative. Note also that a minimum value of 1 is defined for the result of the sum of the IGP-calculated cost and a relative metric value.

isisShortcutMetricValue.name: isisShortcutMetricValue
isisShortcutMetricValue.description: The metric assigned to this IGP shortcut. If isisShortcutMetricType is set to 'metricTypeAbsolute' then this field takes a value in the range of 1 - 16777215. If isisShortcutMetricType is set to 'metricTypeRelative' then this field takes a value in the range of -16777214 to 16777215.

isisShortcutOperStatus.name: isisShortcutOperStatus
isisShortcutOperStatus.description: The operational status of the IGP shortcut interface. The IGP shortcut interface is only usable by DC-ISIS if isisShortcutOperStatus is set to 'up'.

isisShortcutPendingDeletion.name: isisShortcutPendingDeletion
isisShortcutPendingDeletion.description: If 'true' then the IGP shortcut interface has been deleted but has not yet been removed from DC-ISIS because it might still be in use as a TE-tunnel next hop.

isisSdEntTable.name: isisSdEntTable
isisSdEntTable.description: Each entry in this table represents an SDC entity.

isisSdEntEntry.name: isisSdEntEntry
isisSdEntEntry.description: Each entry represents an SDC entity.

isisSdEntIndex.name: isisSdEntIndex
isisSdEntIndex.description: Non-zero index which identifies an SDC entity.

isisSdEntRowStatus.name: isisSdEntRowStatus
isisSdEntRowStatus.description: The row status for this SDC Entity Table entry, used to create and destroy table entries.

isisSdEntAdminStatus.name: isisSdEntAdminStatus
isisSdEntAdminStatus.description: The administrative status of this SDC entity, used to activate and deactivate SDC.

isisSdEntOperStatus.name: isisSdEntOperStatus
isisSdEntOperStatus.description: The current operational status of this SDC entity.

isisSdEntMapHostnames.name: isisSdEntMapHostnames
isisSdEntMapHostnames.description: Should SDC map system IDs to hostnames? If 'true', SDC will fill in the isisISAdjNeighHostname and isisISAdjNeighLanIDHostname objects (if a hostname is known), and will map system IDs to hostnames in PD logs. Setting this object to 'true' will cause a small occupancy increase, because SDC will set up a database of mappings between the system IDs and the corresponding hostnames.

isisSdEntAuthSNPs.name: isisSdEntAuthSNPs
isisSdEntAuthSNPs.description: Should SDC authenticate SNP packets? If 'false', SDC will not check the authentication on SNP packets. If 'true' then it will. Setting this field is sometimes required for interoperability with other routers.

isisSdEntBfdProviderIndex.name: isisSdEntBfdProviderIndex
isisSdEntBfdProviderIndex.description: The entity index for the Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD) provider to which this SDC entity should join. Zero indicates that no BFD provider is available, or that SDC should not join to any BFD provider. This field follows the replaceOnlyWhileDisabled behavior.

isisSdEntStopAdjDuplIDs.name: isisSdEntStopAdjDuplIDs
isisSdEntStopAdjDuplIDs.description: Flag indicating whether this SDC should prevent an adjacency forming to a neighbor with the same System ID but a different SNPA address as an existing neighbor over the same circuit and level. This field can be changed while SDC is active. Doing so will not affect existing adjacencies, but will affect whether further adjacencies form.

isisSdMjTable.name: isisSdMjTable
isisSdMjTable.description: This table controls which entities an SDC entity should join to as master. Each join is represented by a row in this table. The status of each join is represented by a read-only object within each row.

isisSdMjEntry.name: isisSdMjEntry
isisSdMjEntry.description: Represents a join for which this SDC entity is master.

isisSdMjInterface.name: isisSdMjInterface
isisSdMjInterface.description: Identifies the interface required of this master join. Since an SDC only has a single join on any of its interfaces, this serves with the SDC entity index in uniquely identifying the join. This field follows the replaceOnlyWhileDisabled behavior.

isisSdMjRowStatus.name: isisSdMjRowStatus
isisSdMjRowStatus.description: The row status for this master join, used to create and destroy table entries.

isisSdMjAdminStatus.name: isisSdMjAdminStatus
isisSdMjAdminStatus.description: The administrative status of this master join, used to start and stop the join.

isisSdMjOperStatus.name: isisSdMjOperStatus
isisSdMjOperStatus.description: The current operational status of this master join.

isisSdMjEntityIndex.name: isisSdMjEntityIndex
isisSdMjEntityIndex.description: Identifies the slave entity to join with. This index (possibly along with isisSdMjEntityType - see below) is used in the join user data, to enable FTI-specific code within System Manager to select a suitable slave entity. This field follows the replaceOnlyWhileDisabled behavior.

isisSdMjEntityType.name: isisSdMjEntityType
isisSdMjEntityType.description: If isisSdMjInterface is ifSubnetDependent, this field indicates the type of entity to join with. This index along with isisSdMjEntityType is used in the join user data to enable FTI-specific code within System Manager to select a suitable slave entity. This field follows the replaceOnlyWhileDisabled behavior.

isisSdMjJoinStatus.name: isisSdMjJoinStatus
isisSdMjJoinStatus.description: The status of the master join.

isisPduLspId.name: isisPduLspId
isisPduLspId.description: An Octet String that uniquely identifies a Link State PDU.

isisPduFragment.name: isisPduFragment
isisPduFragment.description: Holds up to 64 initial bytes of a PDU that triggered the notification.

isisPduFieldLen.name: isisPduFieldLen
isisPduFieldLen.description: Holds the System ID length reported in PDU we received.

isisPduMaxAreaAddress.name: isisPduMaxAreaAddress
isisPduMaxAreaAddress.description: Holds the Max Area Addresses reported in a PDU we received.

isisAdjState.name: isisAdjState
isisAdjState.description: The current state of an adjacency.

isisErrorOffset.name: isisErrorOffset
isisErrorOffset.description: An offset to a problem in a PDU. If the problem is a malformed TLV, this points to the begining of the TLV. If the problem is in the header, this points to the byte that is suspicious.

isisErrorTLVType.name: isisErrorTLVType
isisErrorTLVType.description: The type for a malformed TLV.

isisNotificationSysInstance.name: isisNotificationSysInstance
isisNotificationSysInstance.description: The unique identifier of the Integrated IS-IS instance for this notification.

isisNotificationSysLevelIndex.name: isisNotificationSysLevelIndex
isisNotificationSysLevelIndex.description: The system level for this notification.

isisNotificationISAdjIndex.name: isisNotificationISAdjIndex
isisNotificationISAdjIndex.description: A unique value identifying the IS adjacency from all other such adjacencies on this circuit.

isisNotificationDisState.name: isisNotificationDisState
isisNotificationDisState.description: The current state of the DIS.

isisNotificationNeighSysID.name: isisNotificationNeighSysID
isisNotificationNeighSysID.description: The system ID of the neighboring Intermediate System.

isisNotificationMtId.name: isisNotificationMtId
isisNotificationMtId.description: The topology for which the IS-IS instance is entering or leaving attached state.

isisDatabaseOverload.name: isisDatabaseOverload
isisDatabaseOverload.description: This notification is generated when the system enters or leaves the Overload state. The number of times this has been generated and cleared is kept track of by isisSysStatLSPDbaseOloads.

isisManualAddressDrops.name: isisManualAddressDrops
isisManualAddressDrops.description: This notification is generated when one of the manual areaAddresses assigned to this system is ignored when computing routes. The object isisNotificationAreaAddress describes the area that has been dropped. The number of times this event has been generated is counted by isisSysManAddrDropFromAreas. This notification is edge triggered, and should not be regenerated until an address that was used in the previous computation has been dropped.

isisIDLenMismatch.name: isisIDLenMismatch
isisIDLenMismatch.description: A notification sent when we receive a PDU with a different value of the System ID Length. This notification includes an index to identify the circuit where we saw the PDU and the header of the PDU which may help a network manager identify the source of the confusion. This should be an edge-triggered notification. We should not send a second notification about PDUs received on the same circuit.

isisMaxAreaAddressesMismatch.name: isisMaxAreaAddressesMismatch
isisMaxAreaAddressesMismatch.description: A notification sent when we receive a PDU with a different value of the Maximum Area Addresses. This notification includes the header of the packet, which may help a network manager identify the source of the confusion. This should be an edge-triggered notification. We should not send a second notification about PDUs received from the same circuit.

isisOwnLSPPurge.name: isisOwnLSPPurge
isisOwnLSPPurge.description: A notification sent when we receive a PDU with our systemID and zero age. This notification includes the circuit Index and router ID from the LSP, if available, which may help a network manager identify the source of the confusion.

isisAreaMismatch.name: isisAreaMismatch
isisAreaMismatch.description: A notification sent when we receive a Hello PDU from an IS which does not share any area address. This notification includes the header of the packet, which may help a network manager identify the source of the confusion. This should be an edge-triggered notification. We should not send a second notification about PDUs received from the same circuit.

isisRejectedAdjacency.name: isisRejectedAdjacency
isisRejectedAdjacency.description: A notification sent when we receive a Hello PDU from an IS, but do not establish an adjacency for some reason. This should be an edge-triggered notification. We should not send a second notification about PDUs received from the circuit.

isisAdjacencyChange.name: isisAdjacencyChange
isisAdjacencyChange.description: A notification sent when an adjacency changes state, entering or leaving state up. The first 6 bytes of the isisPduLspId are the SystemID of the adjacent IS. The isisAdjState is the new state of the adjacency.

isisLSPErrorDetected.name: isisLSPErrorDetected
isisLSPErrorDetected.description: This notification is generated when we receive an LSP with a parse error. The isisCircIfIndex holds in index of the circuit on which the PDU arrived. The isisPduFragment holds start of the LSP, and the isisErrorOffset points to the problem. If the problem is a malformed TLV, isisErrorOffset points to start of the TLV and isisErrorTLVType holds the value of the type. If the problem is with the LSP header, isisErrorOffset points to the suspicious byte. The number of such LSPs is accumulated in isisSysStatLSPErrors.

isisAttemptToExceedMaxSequence.name: isisAttemptToExceedMaxSequence
isisAttemptToExceedMaxSequence.description: When the sequence number on an LSP we generate wraps the 32-bit sequence counter, we purge and wait to re-announce this information. This notification describes that event. Since these should not be generated rapidly, we generate an event each time this happens. While the first 6 bytes of the LSPID are ours, the other two contain useful information.

isisSequenceNumberSkip.name: isisSequenceNumberSkip
isisSequenceNumberSkip.description: When we receive an LSP with our System ID and different contents, we may need to reissue the LSP with a higher sequence number. We send this notification if we need to increase the sequence number by more than one. If two Intermediate Systems are configured with the same System ID, this notification will fire.

isisCircIndTable.name: isisCircIndTable
isisCircIndTable.description: A notification sent when the value of isisCircOperState for a circuit changes to operStatusUp, operStatusDown or operStatusActFailed.

isisExtPassCircuitInd.name: isisExtPassCircuitInd
isisExtPassCircuitInd.description: A notification sent when the value of isisCircOperState for a circuit not configured to run the IS-IS protocol (such as an external, TE-only or passive circuit) changes to operStatusUp, operStatusDown or operStatusActFailed.

isisOperStateChange.name: isisOperStateChange
isisOperStateChange.description: This notification is generated when the IS-IS system changes operational state to operStatusUp, operStatusDown or operStatusActFailed.

isisLspAuthFailure.name: isisLspAuthFailure
isisLspAuthFailure.description: An IS-IS instance sends this notification if a received LSP has failed to authenticate.

isisHelloAuthFailure.name: isisHelloAuthFailure
isisHelloAuthFailure.description: An IS-IS instance sends this notification if a received Hello has failed to authenticate.

isisAttachedStateChange.name: isisAttachedStateChange
isisAttachedStateChange.description: This notification is generated when the Attached state for a topology changes and the topology is operationally up.

isisDisChange.name: isisDisChange
isisDisChange.description: An IS-IS instance sends this notification if the DIS changes at level 1 or level 2.

isisCompliance.name: isisCompliance
isisCompliance.description: The compliance statement for agents that support the IS-IS MIB

isisAdvancedCompliance.name: isisAdvancedCompliance
isisAdvancedCompliance.description: The advanced compliance statement for agents that support the IS-IS MIB

isisSystemGroup.name: isisSystemGroup
isisSystemGroup.description: The collections of objects used to manage an IS-IS router.

isisCircuitGroup.name: isisCircuitGroup
isisCircuitGroup.description: The collection of objects used to describe an IS-IS Circuit.

isisISAdjGroup.name: isisISAdjGroup
isisISAdjGroup.description: The collections of objects used to manage an IS-IS Adjacency.

isisNotificationObjectGroup.name: isisNotificationObjectGroup
isisNotificationObjectGroup.description: The objects used to record notification parameters.

isisNotificationGroup.name: isisNotificationGroup
isisNotificationGroup.description: The collections of notifications sent by an IS.

isisISPDUCounterGroup.name: isisISPDUCounterGroup
isisISPDUCounterGroup.description: The collections of objects used to count protocol PDUs.

isisISIPRADestGroup.name: isisISIPRADestGroup
isisISIPRADestGroup.description: The collections of objects used to manage configured IP addresses.

isisLSPGroup.name: isisLSPGroup
isisLSPGroup.description: The collections of objects used to observe the LSP Data Base.

isisDCAdditionGroup.name: isisDCAdditionGroup
isisDCAdditionGroup.description: The collection of Data Connection additions to the MIB.
